model_answer: The correct answer would be A: A higher sun labeled "Real Sun" positioned above a lower sun labeled "Apparent Sun" over the coastal scene. This image shows how the refraction in the atmosphere causes the apparent position of the sun to appear different from its actual position, providing a visual representation of the concept discussed in the previous video.
B: A data-heavy screen displaying astronomical information with planet and moon positions, including references to "Celestial Clock v3.1" and some Spanish terms.
